plays.title: The Insanity of Mary Girard
plays.copyright: presented with kind permission from Concord Theatricals
plays.synopsis: The real-life story of a Philadelphia woman who spent the last 25 years of her life in a mental institution. In 1790, Mary Girard is committed to an asylum. After she became pregnant by another man, her husband had her declared legally insane. Now, she sits in a chair as the "furies" dance around and impersonate people from her past.

plays.title: There's Always Tomorrow
plays.copyright: presented with kind permission from the playwright
plays.synopsis: Set on a park bench in a small Irish Town in August 2023. In “There's Always Tomorrow”, a chance meeting between a young woman and an older man on a park bench may not be all that it seems. Why has Sarah come here and what is she looking for? As she attempts to uncover the truth, is she fully prepared for what she might find?

plays.title: A Little Box Of Oblivion
plays.copyright: presented with kind permission from StageScripts
plays.synopsis: Set in a different park! “A Little Box Of Oblivion” sees a man's peaceful afternoon in the park gets turned on its head when a woman makes a simple request - keep an eye on this box while she's gone but do not touch, move, or disturb the box in any way. What could possibly be inside the mysterious box? Chaos ensues when he is joined in his wondering by a trio of strangers, each with a more outlandish theory than the last!
